Post-Match Reflections: Mikal Bridges stated, 'Yeah, I mean, definitely better. I think we just still got a lot of work to do. But weâ€™re growing in the right direction.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks' starters put up one of their best games as a unit, as four of them scored 20 or more points.
Defensively, the Knicks allowed the Nets to shoot 41 percent from the three-point line.
They held Brooklyn's Dennis Schroder to 2-11 shooting from the floor for eight points and Cam Thomas to 4-11 shooting from the field for 16 points.
